newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late olein down, export taxes reduced.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late olein down, export taxes reduced.

text.p: Indonesian palm olein prices edged down in late trading on Thursday, with buying interest improving following a rebound in Malaysia, traders said.
They said palm olein was quoted at 1,395-1,400 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, down from 1,400 rupiah at the opening. Crude palm oil was done at 1,213 rupiah/kg at a 500-tonne tender in Medan.
"The rebound in Malaysia saw buyers coming back into the market, but prices continued to suffer," one trader said. "Buyers were making bids below the market range."
Traders said the export taxes for crude palm oil and its products announced by the government were within expectations.

The finance ministry said the tax on crude palm oil was reduced to $39.20 a tonne in June from $47.32 in May. The tax on RBD palm olein was down to $55.30 from $68.60 while that on RBD palm oil was cut to $42.64 from $53.04.
The tax on crude olein was reduced to $58.80 from $66.95.
"The taxes are within market expectations, and will help to improve export competitiveness," one trader said.
